newsitem.title: HUNGARY: MOL edges up after Q1 earnings report.
newsitem.headline: MOL edges up after Q1 earnings report.

text.p: Shares in Hungary's oil and gas company MOL traded a little firmer after a quick rally in the first few minutes of trading on the Budapest Stock Exchange on Tuesday after the release of its Q1 earnings.
At 1042 GMT MOL traded at 3,380 forints, up from Friday's close of 3,370 forints and also recovering from 3,300 forints at opening. Monday was a market holiday in Hungary.
"MOL's earnings did not have too much positive impact," one trader said. "This is because MOL met the market's expectations," he said.
MOL reported its IAS group net income rising to 12.737 billion forints in the first quarter of the year from 8.420 billion in the same period of last year.
The results were broadly in line with MOL's own expectations and were close to a Reuters survey of six analysts and traders on Friday which predicted net income of 13 billion forints.
